newsitem.title: RUSSIA: UES, Irkutskenergo deal seen on Mongolia sales.
newsitem.headline: UES, Irkutskenergo deal seen on Mongolia sales.

text.p: A government-appointed reformer at Russian national power grid holder UES will help forge a deal with Siberian utility Irkutskenergo over its plan to sell power to Mongolia, a top anti-monopoly official said on Wednesday.

UES has blocked Irkutskenergo from exporting electricity to Mongolia on its power lines, without economic or technical reasons, acting chairman of the state anti-monopoly committee Vadim Belov told a news conference.
"It seems to me that the new vice-president of RAO UES (Boris) Brevnov understands all the difficulties of this situation and a compromise will be found," he said.
Irkutskenergo produces some of Russia's cheapest electricity but is forced to sell oversupplies to UES at prices UES sets for resale in Russia.
Brevnov was recently appointed UES vice-president at the urging of the Russian government, which has vowed to reform the company and increase government control over it.
"If no compromise is found, we will continue the matter to its logical end in court and insist that RAO UES respect its competitor Irkutskenergo," Belov said.
He added that the court, which postponed hearings at the request of UES and the committee, would meet again in early June to consider one of a number of suits.
If no compromise is found it would take a total of four of five months from now to solve the problem, he said. The court battle has already lasted about four months, he added.
Belov did not comment on a separate battle between Irkustkenergo and UES over ownership of hydropower stations operated by Irkutskenergo and claimed by UES.
